result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant shall comply with all of the terms of bond, which continues to remain in effect during the period of this agreement. Defendant shall attend AODA and follow through with treatment recommendations, attend domestic violence counseling and write a letter of apology to K.C.H due within 30 days of sentencing to be preapproved by the District Attorney's office.

Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement on Count 1

8:51 AM Defendant Spencer R. Leu in court.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court for Spencer R. Leu.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Plea agreement recited into the record. Plea of no contest to Count 1 in 22CM6. Plea of no contest to the amended charge of Disorderly Conduct on count 3 of 22CM6. Court accepts the plea of no contest on count 3 and finds the defendant guilty. Court orders forfeiture of $263.50 plus $67 victim witness surcharge. Plea of no contest to amended count 5 of Possession of THC-party to a crime in 22CM32. Court accepts the plea of no contest and finds the defendant guilty. Court orders forfeiture of $263.50 plus $67 victim witness surcharge. Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court makes a finding of guilt in count 1 of 22CM6. Statement made by Attorney Fuhr. Statement made by Attorney Snyder. Court orders a deferred entry of judgment agreement for a period of 2 years with conditions of no new criminal charges, compliance with the bond requirements, AODA and follow through with treatment recommendations, domestic violence counseling, a letter of apology to K.C.H due within 30 days of sentencing to be preapproved by the DA's office. Court orders bond modification to eliminate the no contact with the victim K.C.H. Court dismisses but reads in count 2. Court dismisses but reads in counts1-4 in 22CM32.-JN
Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.
Final pre-trial on August 3, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Court would like another settlement conference and final pretrial.

11:18 AM Defendant Spencer R. Leu in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim notification has been complied.  Attorneys have indicated that there are no motions that need to be heard.  Attorney Fuhr is requesting that the new bond be a $1,000.00 signature bond with the same conditions as previously ordered. Bail/bond hearing on June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

DAR started 1:38:42. ADA - Mark Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Vicim notification complied.  Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $500.00 cash bond with conditions of: no contact with K.C.H.; shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  State also requests the court to order the clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in Taylor County Case No. 22CM6.  Court orders bond as requesting with the condition of booking.  Court orders clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings for case no. 22CM6.  Initial appearance set for June 7, 2022 at 1:30 p.m. DAR stopped 1:41:51. ba

01:31 PM Defendant Spencer R. Leu in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim notification has been complied.   Defendant waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Court advised defendant of right to attorney.  Defendant indicates he does not qualify for public defender.  He will file a petition to the court for a court appointed attorney.   Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.   Bond continued.
